common_issues.title: Pieces OS connectivity issues across VS Code and Chrome extensions
common_issues.description: Users report various connectivity problems with Pieces OS on Windows.  VS Code extension fails to connect, showing errors in developer tools and Pieces OS logs. Chrome extension malfunctions, reporting outdated version despite being the latest. Issues persist despite attempts like custom URL settings and Ngrok forwarding. Some users experience VS Code performance degradation while Pieces OS is running.

related_issues.title: WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
related_issues.text:
WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to use Pieces extensions in VS Code for WSL:Ubuntu. Piesces Setting window is empty, but earlier it showed two buttons Launch and Install and when you click on Install, for example, VS Code shows notification that it can't connect to Pieces OS. I tried multiple fixes I found. One is to set Custom URL for Remote environment and I tried with <Windows IP>:1000 and with NGrok forwarding of same url, both without success and I could reach both with curl. There are some errors in VS Code Developer tools related to Pieces OS extension:

Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: version is longer than 256 characters
at new it (settingsView.js:1:5120)
at UH (settingsView.js:1:9927)
at Object.tU (settingsView.js:1:10530)
at vN (settingsView.js:19:354749)

at
https://vscode-remote+wsl-002bubuntu.vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net/home/vladan/.vscode-server/extensions/meshintelligenttechnologiesinc.pieces-vscode-2.0.6/dist/settingsView.js

and Pieces OS log shows error:

GET     [404] /assets/stream/identifiers: port:Instance of 'Future<int>': (2nd server)


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and plugin compatibility issues
common_issues.description: Users report plugin malfunctions, connection failures, and performance degradation with Pieces OS, especially after updates.  A common solution involves ensuring all Pieces components (desktop app, OS, and plugins) are updated to their latest compatible versions, as listed in the 11.0.0 release notes. Check for version compatibility and update accordingly.

related_issues.title: Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
related_issues.text:
Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Web Extension, JetBrains, VS Code, Visual Studio, Obsidian, JupyterLab, Sublime Plugin, Raycast Extension, Pieces CLI, Neovim

### Operating System / Platform

macOS/Windows/Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We introduce one of the largest releases in the Pieces Ecosystem.

Lots of bug fixes - targeting some of the largest hitches in the user journey to name a few: rate limiting(authenticate to bypass, + better error messaging), entirely new Ollama (local LLM) infrastructure w/ in the copilot, and tackling installation head-on.

The detailed list of changes is not quite ready yet; however, it will be here shortly. (I will post them here when they are)

However, this issue is here let you know to update all your plugins and provide the status of all of the new plugins(in the case they are not yet out in production)

Pieces For Developers(Desktop Application): 3.3.0 - Live
PiecesOs: 11.0.0 - Live
vscode: 2.0.0 - Live
JetBrains: 11.0.0 - Live
Visual Studio: 4.0.0 - Live
Jupyter: 1.21.0 - Live
Obsidian: 1.21.0 - Live
Sublime: 1.5.0 - Live
CLI: - 1.9.0 Live
NeoVim: - 1.3.0 Live
Chrome(web) Extension: - 4.0.0 (This is under review)

Please, if you have any questions about the release or are having trouble updating to the latest, comment in this thread, and we can help you out!!

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Issues with LTM and Freezing
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop experiencing issues related to LTM and application freezing. LTM information is sometimes inaccurate or unavailable, leading to incorrect context in Copilot chats.  Additionally, the application freezes after periods of inactivity, especially after chat interactions, requiring a restart. These issues occur across different operating systems (macOS, Windows) and Pieces versions.

related_issues.title: Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
related_issues.text:
Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After I did all my work with LTM turned on, I used the `Start Copilot Chat` button in the **Workstream Activity** View of Pieces Desktop. I asked it to generate some quiz questions based on what I studied, and it started talking about a lot of unrelated topics, even when the context was provided. Though when I started a new chat based on the context again and became more specific with the details such as lecture name and number (that was the one and only thing in the context I started the conversation with), it did it correctly. Also, all this while, the context time showed Last Thursday so I think there is an UI bug too. 

**Context Image:**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab732ff6-d195-4e81-a2af-6cee1e1d2032)

**Chat Image (Where it talks about unrelated topics):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d6abd44-60a0-4f0c-9f8a-1cf1a887fd2e)

**Chat Image (Where it was fixed):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c7d86c81-ba0e-4ec3-8e2f-49a326ac232a)

related_issues.title: bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
related_issues.text:
bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS - 11.4.1
Pieces Desktop - 4.1.3

Pieces desktop randomly freezes after a period of inactivity. I would interact with it in a chat, go back to working in another app and after a while go back to Desktop to find it had frozen. Restart of Pieces Desktop is needed. Note that this problem is very frequent since latest update on May 22nd, but not systematic. I had also noticed this kind of behavior before the updated but put it on the count of my Hardware, Intel i5, 16Gbram Asus Vivobook, but I think I can dismiss this theory.

Where it gets tricky is that this behavior seems to only happen if I had, prior to returning to Pieces Desktop, interacted with a chat. In cases where I simply had started Desktop, worked on something else and gone back to Desktop, it would keep working properly.

Noteworthy: LTM is enabled by default for all chats. Default LLM: Claude 3.7 Sonnet.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App and Plugin Issues on macOS and Windows
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces desktop application and Chrome plugin on macOS and Windows.  Problems include keyboard shortcuts not working on macOS, plugin connection and functionality issues on Windows, and the desktop app periodically jumping to the main monitor on macOS.  Troubleshooting steps include checking for plugin updates and reinstalling the desktop application.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2 performance issues and Copilot memory creation failure
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing performance issues with Pieces OS 11.4.2, including VS Code slowdowns and unresponsiveness. Additionally, the Copilot `create_memory_pieces` tool is failing with a 404 error.  Chat responses are also delayed or absent. The memory creation bug is resolved in 11.4.3.  Users should update to this version. Further investigation is needed for the performance issues and chat response delays.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces OS and plugins, especially for VS Code and Chrome extensions on Windows.  Investigate error messages in developer tools and Pieces OS logs, custom URL settings, Ngrok forwarding, and potential VS Code performance impacts.
Address Pieces OS and plugin compatibility issues by emphasizing the importance of updating all Pieces components to their latest compatible versions, referencing the 11.0.0 release notes.
Investigate and resolve Pieces Desktop issues related to LTM inaccuracy and application freezing after inactivity, focusing on macOS and Windows platforms.

Address macOS and Windows desktop application and plugin issues, including non-functional keyboard shortcuts on macOS, plugin connection problems on Windows, and the desktop app's focus grabbing behavior on macOS. Check for plugin updates and consider desktop application reinstallation.

Investigate Pieces OS 11.4.2 performance issues, including VS Code slowdowns and chat response delays. While the Copilot memory creation bug is resolved in 11.4.3, encourage users to update and continue monitoring performance and chat functionality.

Proactively monitor and address issues related to LTM data persistence after clearing, keyboard shortcut functionality on macOS, and chat response delays or failures across different IDEs and the desktop app.
